newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila share index ends 2.45 pct up at 3,187.78.
newsitem.headline: Manila share index ends 2.45 pct up at 3,187.78.

text.p: * Brokers see start of sustained rally

The Manila share index closed 76.22 points, or 2.45 percent, higher at 3,187.78 on Thursday on buying in blue chips and strong second-liners after the market shook off its apprehensions over U.S. interest rates, brokers said.

"This augurs really well for the market. Now with the release of the expected robust GNP figures at the end of the month and also lower August inflation, this may well be the (start of a) rally," Francisco Trinidad of DBS Securities said.
For the past several days, Manila stocks had laboured under unfounded fears the U.S Fed would raise interest rates during its August 20 meeting.
"Basically every one is getting into the act," Trinidad said when asked who the biggest buyers were.
Of the 30 index issues, 21 gained, three lost and six were untraded.

Brokers said the market had a strong early start because blue chip PLDT rose by $1 1/2 to $59 1/8 on Wall Street overnight. In Manila, PLDT ended 55 pesos up at 1,595 pesos. -- UDAY KHANDEPARKAR (632) 841 8934
